lines.content: LeBook is a lightweight command-line application for managing your personal book collection. Keep track of books you own, borrow, and lend out with simple text commands.
- **Book Management**: Add and delete books from your collection
- **Status Tracking**: Mark books as borrowed or returned
- **Book Listing**: View all books in your library with status indicators
- **Persistence**: Your library is automatically saved between sessions
- **Simple Interface**: Easy-to-remember commands with clear feedback
2. Place the JAR file in your preferred directory
On first run, LeBook will create a data directory for storing your book collection.
| Add Book | `add TITLE / AUTHOR` | Adds a new book to your library |
| Delete Book | `delete BOOK_NUMBER` | Removes a book from your library |
| List Books | `list` | Displays all books in your library |
| Borrow Book | `borrow BOOK_NUMBER` | Marks a book as borrowed |
| Return Book | `return BOOK_NUMBER` | Marks a book as returned |
For a more detailed guide, please refer to the [User Guide](docs/UserGuide.md).
The storage file (`data/LeBook_data.txt`) uses a pipe-separated format:
The Great Gatsby | F. Scott Fitzgerald | 0
LeBook uses JUnit 5 for testing. To run the tests:
The test suite includes unit tests for:
LeBook is a lightweight command-line application for managing your personal book collection. Keep track of books you own, borrow, and lend out with simple text commands.
- **Book Management**: Add and delete books from your collection
- **Status Tracking**: Mark books as borrowed or returned
- **Book Listing**: View all books in your library with status indicators
- **Persistence**: Your library is automatically saved between sessions
- **Simple Interface**: Easy-to-remember commands with clear feedback
2. Place the JAR file in your preferred directory
On first run, LeBook will create a data directory for storing your book collection.
| Add Book | `add TITLE / AUTHOR` | Adds a new book to your library |
| Delete Book | `delete BOOK_NUMBER` | Removes a book from your library |
| List Books | `list` | Displays all books in your library |
| Borrow Book | `borrow BOOK_NUMBER` | Marks a book as borrowed |
| Return Book | `return BOOK_NUMBER` | Marks a book as returned |
For a more detailed guide, please refer to the [User Guide](docs/UserGuide.md).
The storage file (`data/LeBook_data.txt`) uses a pipe-separated format:
The Great Gatsby | F. Scott Fitzgerald | 0
LeBook uses JUnit 5 for testing. To run the tests:
The test suite includes unit tests for:

LeBook is a straightforward book management application that runs on the command line. With its clean interface and simple commands, LeBook helps you keep track of your personal book collection, including which books you've borrowed or lent out.
- Download the latest LeBook.jar from the releases page
Add new books to your library with title and author information.
Example: `add The Great Gatsby / F. Scott Fitzgerald`
[ ] The Great Gatsby (by F. Scott Fitzgerald)
Now you have 1 books in the library.
Remove books from your library when you no longer want to track them.
[ ] The Great Gatsby (by F. Scott Fitzgerald)
Now you have 0 books in the library.
View all the books currently in your library.
Here are the books in your library:
1. [ ] To Kill a Mockingbird (by Harper Lee)
Mark a borrowed book as returned.
Close the application when you're done.
In the list view, books are displayed with their status and details:
- `[ ] Pride and Prejudice (by Jane Austen)` - Available book
- `[X] The Lord of the Rings (by J.R.R. Tolkien)` - Borrowed book
| Add Book | `add TITLE / AUTHOR` | `add The Great Gatsby / F. Scott Fitzgerald` |

*         - An error message if the book number is invalid, missing, or out of range

* @throws NumberFormatException If the book number provided cannot be parsed as an integer
